definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: We would all like to congratulate you on your achievement.
sentences.chinese: 你表現出色，我們都覺得可喜可賀。

sentences.english: Divorce rates are also increasing, though they are still much lower than in America.
sentences.chinese: 離婚率也在上升，但還是美國老大更高，可喜可賀。

sentences.english: These days, a 100-year run is quite thefeat, especially in technology.
sentences.chinese: 百年企業的確可喜可賀，特別是在科技領域。

sentences.english: This is indeed gratifying because it proves that Chinese are not naturally apathetic about politics.
sentences.chinese: 這確實可喜可賀，可證中國人政治上並非天生冷感。

definition: overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
to announce good news/to report success
cheerful and optimistic/in a good mood/gaily
fellow sufferers empathize with each other (idiom); misery loves company
to profit from a disaster (idiom); some good comes out of a setback/It's an ill wind that blows nobody any good.
imaginative/to have one's mind buzzing with ideas
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
report of success/report of a victory
